ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
I have learned understanding the cancer cell from biophysical veiws. including cell-ECM interaction, mechanobiology in the tumor and stromal tissue.
Also learned the simulations of ECM remodeling, cancner cell collective migration and bond lifetime. For the whole semester, the reading and summary expanded my horizen of cancer cell mechanobiology, also provided me with inspiration to to my research project.
The best skill this course provides is reading review and science papers quickly and understanding the content. You also develop skills of understanding the methods used in important papers.
Presentation, review paper writing, cancer mechanobiology and biophysics, matlab
knowledge about cancer hallmarks, cell mechanics, and various treatments.

I learned more about cancer biology as well as current methods and approaches, such as microrheology, to study cancer and attempt to treat it. This class also strengthened my foundation in MATLAB and using computer models for biological interactions.
I have learned many biophysical concepts and methodologies, specifically related to cancer and cancer treatments.
learned a lot about cancer models and a lot from the review papers.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of this course is it is fast paced with each week being some new method or concept we learn about.
It would be great if we can have answer keys and feedback for homework

The strengths of this course were an emphasis on reading scientific literature about cancer which helped my understanding of the information as well as being provided detailed code to model the interactions we learned about in class. One area in which this course can be improved is to have more days working in the lab implemented what was learned in class.

The class is well organized and I like how we covered primary literature, reviews, class materials, presentations, papers, etc. 
I think dividing the class into two sections in two separate days could help us better focus in class.
clearer directions for the final project.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. students can get familiar with cancer mechanobiology. and the recommended paper readings include classical paper and very fresh paper, which can deepen the understanding,combine with modeling module, it can help a lot to learn mechanobiology.
Yes, I enjoyed the class alot because it is a chill class but you also learn alot. You get out what you put in mostly.
I would recommend this course to another student because it emphasizes the translational applications of cancer research, which is a very important and broad area of study.
Yes, I really enjoy the class overall.
yes, you would learn about cancer. take it
